newsitem.title: USA: Innkeepers USA says to acquire 10 hotels.
newsitem.headline: Innkeepers USA says to acquire 10 hotels.

text.p: Innkeepers USA Trust said on Monday it had signed a $127.7 million agreement to acquire 10 hotels from privately held Summerfield Hotel Corp.
As part of the transaction, Innkeepers will adopt a multi-tenant leasing structure with Summerfield becoming an unaffiliated lessee, Innkeepers said in a statement.
Innkeepers also said it expected the acquisition to be accretive to funds from operations per share and to further contribute to FFO per share growth in 1998 and future years.

"The acquisition is a natural extension of our upscale exntended stay strategy," said Innkeepers chief operating officer Fred Shaw. "These hotels compete more with upscale full-service hotels than any other extended stay hotels in the marketplace."
Innkeepers USA Trust, based in Palm Beach, Fla., is an owner of Residence Inns by Marriott.
